intro: Mitrasacme palustris, commonly known as the swamp mitrasacme, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features heart-shaped, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent central pistil. Mitrasacme palustris plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing food and shelter for various insects and small animals.
